ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: By the blessing of your Lord, you are not mad.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: You are not demented by the grace of your Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: By your Lord's Grace, you are not afflicted with madness,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Muhammad), you are not insane, thanks to the bounty of your Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: You are not insane, by the munificence of your Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: You, by the grace of your Lord, are not insane.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: By the grace of your Lord you are not mad.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: thou art not, by the blessing of thy Lord, a man possessed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Thou art not, for thy Lord's favour unto thee, a madman.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: By the grace of your Lord, you are not a mad man.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Thou art nor, through the grace of thy Lord, mad.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: by your Lord’s blessing, you are not, crazy,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Thou art not, by the Grace of thy Lord, mad or possessed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: You (O Muhammad SAW) are not, by the Grace of your Lord, a madman.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: you are not, because of the favor of your Lord, mad.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: By the grace of your Lord, you are not insane.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: You are not, [O Muhammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:2] You are not, O Muhammad (s), by the grace of your Lord, a madman, that is to say, madness is precluded in your case, on account of your Lord’s grace to you by way of [His assigning to you] prophethood and in other ways — this was a refutation of their saying that he was a madman.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Thou art not) O Muhammad, (for your Lord's favour) for the prophethood and Islam bestowed (unto thee, a madman) bewitched. This is the reason why Allah made the above oath.
